1.text: My son, thou shalt not forget my law, and thy heart shall guard my commands:

2.text: For length of days and years of life, and peace they shall add to thee.

3.text: Mercy and truth shall not forsake thee: bind them upon thy throat; write them upon the tablet of thy heart:

4.text: And find grace and good understanding in the eyes of God and man.

5.text: Trust to Jehovah with all thy heart; and thou shalt not lean to thine understanding.

6.text: In all thy ways know him, and he will make straight thy paths.

7.text: Thou shalt not be wise in thine eyes: fear Jehovah and depart from evil.

8.text: It shall be healing to thy sinews, and moistening to thy bones.

9.text: Honor Jehovah from thy substance, and from the first-fruits of all thy produce.

10.text: And thy storehouses shall be filled with abundance, and thy wine-vats shall break forth with new wine.

11.text: My son, thou shalt not reject the instruction of Jehovah, and thou shalt not loathe upon his reproofs:

12.text: For whom Jehovah shall love he will rebuke, as a father the son he will delight in.

13.text: Happy the man finding wisdom; and the man shall bring forth understanding.

14.text: For good her gain above the gain of silver, and her increase above gold.

15.text: She is precious above red corals: and all thy delights shall not be equal with her.

16.text: Length of days in her right hand; in her left, riches and honor.

17.text: Her ways the ways of pleasantness, and all her beaten paths, peace.

18.text: She is a tree of life to all holding upon her: and happy he holding her fast.

19.text: Jehovah by wisdom founded the earth; he prepared the heavens by understanding.

20.text: By his knowledge the depths were rent, and the clouds will drop dew.

21.text: My son, they shall not depart from thine eyes: keep counsel and meditation:

22.text: And they shall be life to thy soul, and grace to thy throat.

23.text: Then shalt thou go thy way confidently, and thy foot shall not stumble.

24.text: If thou shalt lie down thou shalt not be afraid: and thou liest down and thy sleep shall be sweet.

25.text: Thou shalt not be afraid from sudden terror, and from the destruction of the unjust when it shall come.

26.text: For Jehovah shall be in thy confidence, and he watched thy foot from being taken.

27.text: Thou shalt not withhold good from those possessing it in its being to the power of thy hand to do.

28.text: Thou shalt not say to thy neighbor, Go, and turn back, and to-morrow I will give; and there is with thee.

29.text: Thou shalt not fabricate evil upon thy neighbor, and he dwelling confidently with thee.

30.text: Thou shalt not contend with man to no purpose, if he did thee no evil.

31.text: Thou shalt not envy against a man of violence, and thou shalt choose in all his ways.

32.text: For the perverse is an abomination of Jehovah: and his intercourse with the upright.

33.text: The curse of Jehovah is in the house of the unjust one: and he will bless the dwelling of the just.

34.text: But he will deride to those deriding: and he will give grace to the humble.

35.text: The wise shall inherit glory, and the foolish exalt dishonor.
